com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors

Class ActionAllowedAuthorizationViewProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors.SimpleEntityViewProcessorAdapter
      • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors.ActionAllowedAuthorizationViewProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityViewProcessor

    public class ActionAllowedAuthorizationViewProcessor
extends SimpleEntityViewProcessorAdapter
    Responsible for checking if the view is actually allowed. Requires the EntityConfiguration or EntityAssociation to be visible, and the principal to have the AllowableAction.

    If no AllowableAction is configured, only the visibility check for the EntityConfiguration or EntityAssociation will be done.

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

    • Method Detail

      • authorizeRequest

        public void authorizeRequest(EntityViewRequest entityViewRequest)
        Description copied from interface: EntityViewProcessor
        Verify the EntityViewRequest is valid for this factory. This usually means things like performing security checks and checking all individual properties are valid.

        Any invalid requests are expected to throw the most relevant exceptions.

        Called after EntityViewProcessor.prepareEntityViewContext(ConfigurableEntityViewContext) but before initializing the command object.

        Specified by:
        authorizeRequest in interface EntityViewProcessor
        Overrides:
        authorizeRequest in class SimpleEntityViewProcessorAdapter
        Parameters:
        entityViewRequest - request to validate

      • setRequiredAllowableAction

        public void setRequiredAllowableAction(com.foreach.across.modules.spring.security.actions.AllowableAction requiredAllowableAction)
        Set the AllowableAction that the principal should have on the EntityConfiguration being viewed. This will take the entity instance into account if there is one.

      • getRequiredAllowableAction

        public com.foreach.across.modules.spring.security.actions.AllowableAction getRequiredAllowableAction()
